posts.title: Reza The Illusionist Coming To The Jones Center
posts.content:
Prepare to be amazed! Touring illusionist, Reza, is bringing his dynamic Edge of Illusion performance to The Jones Center on Nov 6 at 2p. 

  • Not your dad’s magic: Not one for pulling rabbits out of hats, Reza’s show combines high-tech lighting and acoustics, delivering a concert-style experience great for both kids and adults.
  • Meet the artist: Tickets are $15 for children, $25 for adults, and $40 for a premium VIP package with preferred seating and a meet-and-greet with the artist.

Tickets are on sale now HERE.

posts.title: So Much To Enjoy At Crystal Bridges This Fall
posts.content:
There are some amazing events and exhibits planned this fall at Crystal Bridges beginning this weekend with multiple Halloween parties. 

  • Happy Halloween: Crystal Bridges will celebrate Halloween weekend with an adult only Fashion Party on Friday, a Fashion Teen Night on Saturday, and a family-friendly Trick Art Treat through the North Forest on Sunday. 
  • Art inside and out: Don’t miss the current exhibit, Fashioning America: Grit to Glamour, or your chance to experience the Listening Forest and Architecture At Home exhibit this season out on the trails. 

Find these events, exhibits, and more in the Fall Guide to Crystal Bridges HERE.

posts.title: Get Your Costumes Ready For The Halloween Pub Crawl On Dickson St.
posts.content:
Throw on your costumes and head to Dickson St. for the Halloween Pub Crawl on Saturday, Oct 29 from 5-10p. 

  • Do the bar hop: Register for the event online or at Ryleigh’s on the day of the event to get your passport which can be stamped at the 11 participating bars. 
  • Who wore it best: Be sure to stop by The Piano Bar at 9p for the costume contest for a chance to win $250 or $100 for the winner and runner-up. 

Pub crawl tickets are $20 and can be found online HERE.

posts.title: All Aboard The Fright Train In Downtown Springdale
posts.content:
It’s the last week of Ozarktober in Downtown Springdale, and things are getting festive for Halloween. 

  • Music: LIVE! At Turnbow this Thursday, Oct 27 will feature live music by Proyecto Tumbado at 6:30p followed by John Mailander’s Forecast ft. Lindsay Lou at 8:00p. 
  • All aboard: Head down to the A&M Railroad Station on Emma Ave to board a festive Halloween Train! Or if you’re up for a real fright, hop on the Haunted Train for a terrifyingly good time. 

Get your tickets for the Ozarktober events HERE.

posts.title: Early Voting For The 2022 General Election Begins Today
posts.content:
Early voting for the Arkansas General Election, school elections, and court election starts today, giving citizens over two weeks to cast their ballot before Election Day on Nov 8. 

  • Where to go: Look up your voter registration online HERE for a list of locations available for you to vote from. 
  • What to know: Download this 2022 Arkansas Ballot Issue Voter Guide to know what will be on the ballot and what your vote for or against will mean. 

Find other helpful voter resources HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Bring the power: All women in STEM are invited to apply for the 2023 EMPOWER Cohort, a 16-week accelerator program hosted by Startup Junkie and Science Venture Studio.* 
  • Go Hogs go: The Razorback Men’s Basketball Team hosts Rogers State at Bud Walton Area for the first exhibition game of the season tonight at 7p.
  • Keep Cujo safe: Keep your pet safe this weekend with some Halloween Pet Safety Advice from Best Friends Animal Society. 
  • Mind power: Monk Khentrul Lodro T'haye Rinpoche, who lives and teaches Tibetan Buddhism here in the Ozarks, recently released a new book about training the mind. 
  • Smell my feet: Using a data-driven method, Kuru Footwear determined these Arkansas cities as the best for trick-or-treating. 
  • Tell it: Have a story? We have room in the newsletter for you! Check out our deals HERE.

*Content is sponsored
